summary: David Ferrie is mentioned in several documents related to investigations surrounding the JFK assassination. He appears to have been involved in suspicious activities and conversations, as indicated by a phone call reported by Jimmy Johnson. Anthony William Atzenhoffer Jr. recalls Ferrie's association with Lee Harvey Oswald and the Civil Air Patrol Cadets (CAPC) in New Orleans. Phillip Geraci recalls Oswald's interaction with Carlos Bringuier and his limited association with David Ferrie. Additionally, the CIA provided sanitized notes on David Ferrie to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA).
significance: David Ferrie's significance in the JFK assassination context stems from his connections to Lee Harvey Oswald and his alleged involvement in suspicious activities. The documents suggest that Ferrie was a person of interest in the investigations following the assassination, with his name appearing in CIA records and witness testimonies.
